intro: Clidemia microthyrsa, commonly known as the velvetleaf or tropical milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety pubescence. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, with four petals. Clidemia microthyrsa is often found in moist, shaded environments and can be invasive in some regions.
